id.description: The ID used to identify this component in Dash callbacks.

className.description: The class name for the panel group used for styling

collapsedSize.description: Panel should collapse to this size (in percentage or pixels)

collapsible.description: Whether Panel should collapse when resized beyond its minSize

order.description: Order of panel within group; required for groups with conditionally rendered panels

id.description: The ID used to identify this component in Dash callbacks.

autoSaveId.description: Unique id used to auto-save group arragement via local storage.

className.description: The class name for the panel group for styling

direction.description: Direction of the panel group - horizontal or vertical

style.description: Additonal style for the panel group

id.description: The ID used to identify this component in Dash callbacks.

className.description: The class name for the panel group for styling

style.description: Additional style for the panel group

src/lib/components/ResizableModal.react..description:
ResizableModal Component

A modal dialog component that can be resized by dragging from configurable corners.
Provides extensive customization options for Dash developers including resize handles,
positioning, styling, and callback functions.

id.description: The ID used to identify this component in Dash callbacks.

children.description: The children of this component (modal content).

isOpen.description: Whether the modal is currently open/visible.

title.description: The modal title. Can be a string or React element.

width.description: Initial width of the modal in pixels.

height.description: Initial height of the modal in pixels.

x.description: Initial X position from the left edge in pixels.

y.description: Initial Y position from the top edge in pixels.

rightOffset.description:
Distance from the right edge of the screen in pixels.
If specified, overrides x positioning.

bottomOffset.description:
Distance from the bottom edge of the screen in pixels.
If specified, overrides y positioning.

resizeCorner.description: Which corner to show the resize handle on.

showResizeIcon.description: Whether to show a resize icon and what type.

customResizeIcon.description: Custom resize icon element to display.

showCloseButton.description: Whether to show a close button in the header.

customCloseIcon.description: Custom close icon element to display instead of default X.

onResize.description: Callback fired when the modal is resized.

onMove.description: Callback fired when the modal is moved.

onClose.description: Callback fired when the modal is closed.

draggable.description: Whether the modal can be dragged by its header.

dragHandle.description:
Which area of the modal can be used for dragging.
- 'header': Only the header area (default)
- 'modal': Entire modal except resize handle
- 'custom': Only elements with data-drag-handle="custom"

dragBounds.description:
Constraints for modal dragging.
- null: No constraints (default)
- 'viewport': Keep within browser viewport
- object: { top, right, bottom, left } pixel bounds

resizable.description: Whether the modal can be resized.

modal.description: Whether to display as a modal (with backdrop).

backdrop.description: Whether to show a backdrop overlay.

backdropClosable.description: Whether clicking the backdrop closes the modal.

escapeClosable.description: Whether pressing escape closes the modal.

className.description: CSS class name for the modal container.

style.description: Inline styles for the modal container.

headerClassName.description: CSS class name for the modal header.

headerStyle.description: Inline styles for the modal header.

bodyClassName.description: CSS class name for the modal body.

bodyStyle.description: Inline styles for the modal body.

resizeHandleClassName.description: CSS class name for the resize handle.

resizeHandleStyle.description: Inline styles for the resize handle.

zIndex.description: Z-index for the modal (backdrop will be zIndex - 1).

animation.description: Whether to enable open/close animations (future feature).
